row.html:
Overview
Command Reference
Documentation
Support
Command: xsWhere
Category: Conceptual Search
Description: Determine which events are compatible with a semantic query. An event is compatible with the query if the compatibility index (xcix) is greater than the alfacut. The default alfacut is 0.2. If an event meets this condition, it is written to the output stream with the value of the xcix added as a field named by cixname. The default is "WhereCIX". If not, the event is disposed. The xcix is generated using one of two functions, avg or weighted. The avg function sums the membership values of each query and divides by the count. The weighted function is similar to a weighted average. The xcix is calculated by putting a higher value on memberhip in terms that are closer to the beginning of the query, and then divides by the weighted count. Since the xcix is added to each event that meets the alfacut, other commands can then be applied to generate more intelligent information.
Syntax: xswhere [alfacut=value] [cixname=string] [cixtype=avg|weighted] xswhere-option (xswhere-andor-option xswhere-option)*
Example: ... | xswhere AirTime is minimal or AirTime is short
Returns all of the events where the field AirTime is minimal or AirTime is short, as determined by the set "AirTime"
Example: ... | xswhere cixtype=weighted AirTime is minimal or AirTime is short
Returns all of the events where the field AirTime is minimal or AirTime is short, as determined by the set "AirTime". The algorithm used to determined the compatability index is "weighted average".
Parameters: alfacut, cixname, cixtype, synonyms, xswhere-andor-option, xswhere-option
alfacut
The minimal acceptable value of the compatability index (CiX) needed for the event to be considered as a match for the query. The default is 0.2.
cixname
The name of the field containing the Compatability Index (Cix). The default is "WhereCIX".
cixtype
The function used to generate the cix. The choices are "average" and "weighted". The default is "average". .
synonyms
The lookup file that contains the synonyms to be used as hedges. This is a csv file that lives in the lookups directory.
xswhere-andor-option
The connector between xswhere-option. This can be AND or OR. .
xswhere-option
The compatibility query. The query is structured as follows: field [IN contextField] IS [hedge]* set. The field must be one of the fields in the event. The contextField is optional. If contextField is specified, it is evaluated as follows: First, determine if this is the name of a field. If so, then use the contents of that field in each event as the name of the context, else use the value of the context as the name of the Context.
If the contextField is not specified, the query uses a context of the same name as the field. A hedge can be one or more of the following: above, after, before, below, close extremely, generally, not, positively, slightly, somewhat, very, vicinity. The set is the name of a set in the context. .
Learn more:
Scianta Analytics Extreme Search for Splunk documentation
